page.title: 03ECOLOGY (1) - DUNURE
page.content: The area is bounded by coast line, high cliffs,narrow rocky shore,small sandy bays.Coast line considerable geological interest due to exposures of old red sandstone,lavas,and tertiary dykes.Diversity of coastal habitat includes dune,grassland shingle banks,rock pools,scrub and para-maritime woodlands e.g.Drumbain Glen.Coast line east to A719 under conservation agreement with National Trust for Scotland.Adjoining land rising from coast to Carrick Hills mainly free draining based on old red sandstone,wetter areas to north based on underlying lavas and basalt. Botanically very important.Cliff communities rich in maritime species. Flora recorded in area approx. 180 species.Includes 5 orchids - Early Purple,Heath Spotted,Spotted,Sweet Scented and Lesser Butterfly Orchid.
